job.title: Sr Program Management Consultant - Medical Devices (32608)
job.description:
Sr Project Management Consultant
Location: Waukegan, IL (3 days onsite)
Company: Myticas's direct client based in North Chicago, IL

NOTE:
Need a seasoned, higher level Program Manager having experience managing projects related to medical devices or medical equipment. That kind of specialized expertise is essential given the technical and regulatory aspects of the EEG brain scan initiative.
Will be meeting with VP and Vendors as well as being responsible for budget management.


Summary

One of our Direct clients is looking to add a Seasoned Sr Project/Program Management Consultant to their team. The main project is tied to an EEG brain scan technology and the person needs to have an SDLC background. Experience with medical devices and phase 1 installation would be a great nice-to-have. This individual will be meeting with VP and Vendors as well as being responsible for budget management.

Key Responsibilities

  • Initiate and Plan Project: Works with business and IT management to establish and gain consensus on project goals, objectives, financials and deliverables. Responsible for building the plan and resources needs to accomplish the scope.
  • Project Control: Assess the degree to which changes to scope, issues and risks will affect the project working with business and IT management and sponsor to gain agreement for resolution. Measure performance to assure the project is progressing as compared to original plan and budget.
  • Executing and Closing Project: Develops and executes a work plan obtaining authorized resources to ensure all activities are performed. Leads team in delivering project scope. Gather lessons learned and obtain final project approval from sponsor and stakeholders.
  • Project Communication: Communicate project progress by producing project reports to provide timely and accurate program status and decision support information to project teams, business, and IT management. Makes recommendations based on current project status to resolve issues and manage risks.
  • Resource and Team Management: Coordinate resources to ensure project needs are addressed and effectively assign tasks and deliverables to team members based upon their abilities. Motivates project team in order to deliver project outcomes.
  • Quality Management: Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and functional policies and procedures.
  • Decisions: Make decisions that impact project level activities. Influences or has final decision authority for project budget.
  • Financial Control: Develops and manages a financial plan with multi-million dollar spend. Tracks actual spend, accruals, proactively creates spend estimates on a regular basis (at least monthly) and coordinates estimates and invoices with project vendors, in order to maintain spend at +/- 10% of the overall project budget.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems/Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Proven Microsoft Project, PowerPoint, Excel, and Word skills are required.
  • 5-10 years of experience in project management
  • Experience managing SDLC projects.
  • Key Stakeholders:
  • Business and Technology resources; varying levels of leadership

Preferred Qualifications

  • PMP Certification
  • PPM Tool experience
  • Pharmaceutical experience
  • Experience managing projects to deliver or enhance validated systems.

This is a hybrid position requiring both remote and onsite work in Waukegan, IL.

job.title: Product Line Manager - CIP (31639)
job.description:
The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is currently seeking an experienced Optical Networking resource who would be interested in working within the CIP vertical.

We are looking for a candidate who is currently based in Canada since this is offered on a remote full-time permanent basis and requires the resource to be located within the country.

The candidate in this role should have the following requirements:

  • Highly experienced in CIP Optical Networking Deployment
  • Over 8 Years of Optical Networking expertise
  • Experience with Optical Network deployment and system development
  • Experience with Optical PLM
  • Experience with Operational Support Systems
  • Experience with Open Standards and Concepts

job.title: Banking Technology Integration Consultant - Lockbox/Payments (32606)
job.description:
We are seeking an experienced Banking Technology Integration Consultant (Lockbox/Payments) Implementation Specialist to support a large financial institution’s transformation project. This role focuses on the implementation and integration of cheque imaging, lockbox services, exception/returns handling, and ensuring compliance with North American regulatory requirements.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead and support the implementation of cheque processing technologies and lockbox solutions.

  • Conduct discovery sessions with business stakeholders and product owners.

  • Develop strategy, planning documentation, and ensure smooth technical integration.

  • Interface with vendors and internal stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver end-to-end solutions.

  • Ensure compliance with Canada and U.S. cheque processing regulations.

Qualifications:

  • 10+ years of experience in financial services or banking technology.

  • Proven experience in cheque processing and lockbox solution implementation.

  • Familiarity with North American regulatory requirements.

  • Experience working at Symcor or implementing similar solutions in the U.S. is highly desirable.

  • Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.

job.title: Bilingual Salesforce Business Analyst – Grantmaking (32602)
job.description:
Our client, a leading financial institution, is seeking a skilled Bilingual Salesforce Business Analyst with hands-on experience in Salesforce Non-Profit Cloud and grantmaking processes to support a high-impact digital transformation initiative within their Banking Technology division.

This role is ideal for a business-oriented professional who brings strong financial services experience, paired with Salesforce consulting expertise. The selected candidate will drive actionable insights and process improvements across Salesforce platforms, enabling smarter decision-making and operational efficiency.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, document, and analyze business requirements.

  • Evaluate and streamline current business processes.

  • Create functional specifications, business cases, and support implementation efforts.

  • Generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations using Salesforce and data tools.

  • Facilitate stakeholder meetings and communicate findings effectively.

  • Support testing and project planning within Agile/Scrum environments.

  • Ensure alignment with business goals, compliance, and technology best practices.

Required Qualifications:

  • Mandatory: Experience with Salesforce Non-Profit Cloud and grantmaking workflows.

  • Minimum 3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst in the financial services industry.

  • 2+ years of experience in a consulting environment.

  • Strong analytical skills; experience with Excel, SQL, Power BI/Tableau, and project tools.

  • Experience with multiple Salesforce clouds, including:

  • Sales Cloud

  • Service Cloud

  • Experience Cloud

  • Financial Services Cloud

  • Exceptional BILINGUAL communication and stakeholder engagement skills. (FRENCH)

  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodology.

job.title: Technical Lead – Core Banking Assessment (Hybrid, Toronto) (32596)
job.description:
Myticas Consulting is seeking an experienced Technical Lead for a short-term contract engagement supporting a Core Banking Assessment for a large Canadian financial institution. This role will involve both strategic and technical contributions and will be delivered in two phases: current state evaluation and future state solution recommendation.

Project Overview:

The engagement will support a Core Banking Assessment project structured in two phases:

Phase 1 – Current & Target State Assessment:

  • Understand the client’s strategy and identify supporting core banking capabilities.
  • Define the target state core banking capability model.
  • Assess the current state of each capability, platforms in use, and gaps.
  • Recommend potential solutions to enhance/augment each capability.

Phase 2 – Solution Fit & Business Case:

  • Conduct a market scan of available core banking solution providers.
  • Identify and assess best-fit solutions.
  • Build a detailed business case for the selected core banking platform.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Facilitate workshops with stakeholders and technical teams.
  • Translate executive strategy into defined banking capabilities.
  • Capture current state maturity and identify platform inefficiencies.
  • Analyze technical complexities of core banking systems.
  • Provide solution recommendations and market insights.
  • Develop a business case aligned with the organization’s strategy.

Required Skills and Experience:

  • 5–10 years of experience in technical leadership roles within banking/financial services

  • General knowledge of core banking systems; Wealthview experience is a strong asset

  • Understanding of infrastructure, integration, IT operations, risk, and compliance

  • Experience facilitating executive and technical workshops

  • Strong client-facing communication and stakeholder management skills

  • Familiarity with IT vendor management and technical architecture concepts

Work Model:
Hybrid – based in Toronto, with 2–3 days per week in office

job.title: QA Laboratory Sample Handler (32580)
job.description:
Job Title: QA Laboratory Sample Handler

Contract Duration: 6 months (with potential for extension)
Location: Onsite – Ada, MI
Travel: Local transportation (between facilities)
Pay Rate: $19.00 per hour

Company Overview:
Clover Consulting (a Myticas company) is currently seeking a QA Laboratory Sample Handler for a well-established client located in Ada, MI. This is a contract position with strong potential for extension. Please note, this is not a laboratory testing role but may offer future opportunities to gain laboratory experience.

Position Summary:
The QA Laboratory Sample Handler is responsible for transporting a variety of sample types—including in-process materials, finished products, raw materials, and miscellaneous samples—between different locations on the Ada complex and the Spaulding facility.

Sample pickups are scheduled throughout the day via a paging system and are transported using a Ford Transit minivan. A significant portion of the collected samples will also require entry into the enterprise QA data system (LIMS).

Key Responsibilities:

  • Collect, verify, and distribute samples as scheduled
  • Log sample information into the LIMS system
  • Perform minimal verification testing as needed
  • Maintain proper documentation and sample tracking
  • Manage daily tasks with strong organizational and time-management skills
  • Qualifications:
  • Valid State of Michigan driver's license (travel required between Ada complex and Spaulding facility)
  • Basic computer skills
  • Background in science or a related field is preferred, but not required

job.title: Technical Support and Customer Service Associate (32581)
job.description:
Technical Support and Customer Service Associate - REMOTE

Contract: 12 months with possible CTH
Schedule: 3rd shift - 12 am to 9 am, Tuesday thru Saturday
Work Type: Fully Remote

Myticas is actively seeking a Technical Support and Customer Service Associate for a direct client to join their Personal Support Center (PSC) team. This role is perfect for someone with a passion for helping others, a knack for troubleshooting, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, tech-forward environment.

As a PSC Associate, you’ll be the first point of contact for users via phone, email, and chat—working to resolve technical issues, answer questions, and ensure a seamless customer experience. You'll be supported by extensive training, a detailed knowledge base, and a collaborative team ready to help you grow.

What You’ll Do:
  • Provide Tier 1 technical support for software, hardware, and connectivity issues
  • Assist with password resets, software installations, VPN setups, and general troubleshooting
  • Escalate complex issues to senior team members when needed
  • Maintain clear, professional communication across all customer interactions
  • Simultaneously manage support requests via phone, email, and chat
  • Accurately log cases using tools like ServiceNow and Zendesk
What We’re Looking For:
  • Strong customer service and communication skills
  • Comfort working in a flexible, 24/7/365 support environment
  • Ability to adapt to new tools, systems, and processes quickly
  • Team player who’s open to ongoing feedback, learning, and development
Why Join Us:
  • Hands-on training and mentoring
  • Access to a robust internal knowledge base
  • Opportunities to collaborate with tech experts and leadership
  • A supportive team environment where growth is encouraged
If you're ready to jump into a dynamic support role where no two days are the same, apply now or reach out to learn more. We’re excited to meet you!

job.title: Digital Content Specialist (32576)
job.description:
Job Title: Digital Content Specialist
Location: On-Site – Grand Rapids, MI
Contract Duration: 6+ Months (Extensions Likely)
Company: Clover Consulting (a Myticas Company)
Client: Direct Client in Grand Rapids, MI
Note: Local candidates preferred. This role is not eligible for sponsorship.

Job Overview:
Clover Consulting is seeking a Digital Content Specialist to support our client’s marketing efforts in Grand Rapids, MI. This is a full-time, on-site contract opportunity with a strong possibility of extension. The successful candidate will assist in the development and execution of CRM campaigns using a newly implemented customer 360 database and marketing automation platform.

About the Team:
The North American CRM team designs and implements marketing strategies that leverage automation software to enhance lead generation, sales, retention, productivity, and customer loyalty—particularly focused on Independent Business Owners (IBOs) and consumers.

Role Summary:
As a Digital Content Specialist, you will be responsible for supporting the planning, development, deployment, and analysis of CRM campaigns. These communications target IBOs, customers, or a combination of both. Your primary responsibility is to ensure all campaigns are executed accurately and on schedule.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Serve as the main liaison between internal stakeholders, external agencies, and the CRM production team.
  • Manage CRM campaign deliverables, including planning, timelines, risk management, and resource allocation.
  • Submit use cases and other documentation for internal review and approval.
  • Schedule creative briefings and manage content development updates.
  • Route creative materials, compile proof comments, and finalize HTML content for translation.
  • Conduct thorough quality assurance checks on email content in all supported languages and markets (including verification of links, artwork, and videos).
  • Educate stakeholders on the capabilities of the CRM platform.
  • Track campaign progress and update timelines and work estimates as needed.
  • Distribute final CRM creative assets to internal stakeholders for reference.
  • Provide on-call support for end-of-month and urgent field email communications, per established protocols.
  • Serve as a backup to the Email Coordinator.

Required Qualifications:

  • Associate's or Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field; equivalent certifications will also be considered.
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience in Communications, Marketing, or a related discipline.
  • Basic knowledge of CRM platforms.
  • Ability to independently resolve routine issues.
  • Capable of performing assigned tasks and supporting projects under supervision.

Preferred Skills and Attributes:

  • Strong passion for marketing and delivering a top-tier user experience to engage both customers and IBOs.
  • Solid understanding of email marketing strategies, triggered campaigns, and A/B testing to optimize business performance.
  • Proven ability to collaborate effectively with internal teams and external vendors.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Flexible and able to perform well under pressure and tight deadlines.
  • Critical thinking, problem-solving, and follow-through skills.
  • High level of professionalism and attention to detail.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Willingness and ability to work on-site at the client location in Grand Rapids, MI.

job.title: Senior Packet Processing Software Developer (32079)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Senior Software Engineer with expertise in Packet Processing to join our team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in designing and optimizing high-performance network systems, with a strong background in developing scalable, low-latency solutions for data-intensive environments. In this role, you will work on cutting-edge technologies to enhance network protocols and packet processing frameworks. Your contributions will play a key role in delivering robust, reliable, and efficient network operations, ensuring our systems meet the evolving demands of modern infrastructure.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with experienced engineers in the design, coding, testing, and maintenance of software applications.
  • Develop and maintain embedded software modules using programming languages such as C++ and Python.
  • Design and implement high-performance packet processing applications using DPDK and similar frameworks.
  • Optimize network functions for maximum throughput and minimal latency.
  • Develop and maintain packet processing pipelines for various network functions.
  • Troubleshoot complex performance issues in packet processing applications.
  • Assist in the implementation of networking solutions to ensure seamless communication between software components.
  • Contribute to the development of software tools, libraries, and frameworks to enhance overall product quality and efficiency.
  • Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to improve code quality and adherence to coding standards.
  • Collaborate with the team to troubleshoot and resolve software defects and technical issues.
  • Support the integration of software components on Linux operating systems.
  • Assist in the testing and validation of software features to ensure functionality and performance meet specified requirements.
  • Utilize cloud technologies to enhance software deployment and management.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers and designers, to understand requirements and contribute to technical discussions.
  • Maintain clear and organized documentation of software designs, processes, and development tasks.
  • Demonstrate effective teamwork and communication skills, both orally and in writing.
  • Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.

Education & Experience Required:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  • In-depth knowledge of packet processing development.
  • Experience with the Vector Packet Processing (VPP) framework is a plus.
  • Deep understanding of DPDK architecture and APIs.
  • Familiarity with modern NIC features (e.g., RSS, checksum offload, scatter-gather).
  • Experience with AF_XDP or similar kernel bypass technologies.
  • Strong understanding of Linux-based network stacks, kernel modules, and performance optimization.
  • Ideally 8+ years of experience in C/C++ for low-level network programming and high-performance packet processing.
  • Solid understanding of networking concepts and protocols, including TCP/IP, UDP, VXLAN, GRE, etc.
  • Familiarity with cloud technologies is a plus.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively within a diverse team.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Enthusiasm for learning new technologies and tools.
  • Detail-oriented with a commitment to producing high-quality software.
  • Ability to design software with consideration for hardware resource constraints.
  • Experience in software development for satellite communication systems is a plus.

job.title: NMS Developer (32446)
job.description:
As a Network Management System Developer, you’ll be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our network by designing, implementing, testing and maintaining Operational Support Systems (OSS). Your role will be instrumental in optimizing network performance, enhancing efficiency, and ensuring a seamless customer experience.

Main Responsibilities

  • Design network management solutions to monitor and manage Carrier
  • Ethernet and IP services, ensuring optimal capacity, performance and reliability
  • Define configurations and notification data models using YANG
  • Define real-time network monitoring solutions
  • Program network automation with gNMI/gNOI/NETCONF/RESTCONF
  • Design, Develop and maintain automated scripts and tools to verify NMS functionality
  • Work with vendors to implement new OSS/NMS solutions
  • Review and approve design documents, test strategies, plans, and scripts
  • Maintain accurate documentation of OSS/NMS requirements, configurations, processes, and procedures
  • Resolve complex OSS/NMS implementation and network problems with cross-functional teams
  • Enforce security best practices to protect network systems and data integrity

Education and Experience Required

  • Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field
  • 2-5 experience in a similar role.
  • Proficient in Layer 2/3 protocols, YANG modeling, gRPC/gNMI/gNOI
  • Experience designing network management systems using Layer 2/3 protocols
  • Programming skills in modern C++, GNU C, Go, Python 3.x
  • TDD and BDD test frameworks
  • Knowledge of developing software in container hosted in Linux environment and microservices
  • Knowledge of Protobuf, XML, JSON IETF encoding, and template language (Jinja2)
  • Good problem-solving, and communication skills
  • Experience with NMS products like Netcracker Digital OSS, ONAP, Ciena Blue Planet, Amdocs

Knowledge in Protocols and Standards:

  • Layer 3 protocols: IP, OSPF, BGP, MPLS, SR-MPLS
  • Layer 2 protocols: Ethernet, VLAN, STP, LACP
  • MEF and TMF Standards

job.title: Senior Software Technical Support Specialist (32305)
job.description:
The Senior SoftwareTechnical Support Specialist will provide expert-level technical assistance and strategic support the customers, partners, and cross-functional teams. This role involves complex issue resolution, leadership in support process improvement, ownership of professional service projects focused on product customization and integrations, deploying software solutions, onboarding new customers, and proactive engagement in optimizing team tools, processes, and customer issues. This individual will drive support initiatives, lead escalations, and act as a liaison with the engineering team to implement solutions resolving customer-reported bugs and issues.

Requirements

Essential Functions

  • Lead and Resolve Advanced Technical Issues: Provide exceptional, senior-level support by diagnosing and resolving complex technical issues for customers, partners, and sales engineers, demonstrating technical leadership and initiative.
  • Deployment and Customer Onboarding: Manage the deployment of our clients software solutions, ensuring smooth transitions for new customers and providing comprehensive onboarding to maximize product adoption and success.
  • Customer Impact Focus: Act as the primary point of escalation for challenging, high-impact technical issues, driving timely and effective resolutions for mission-critical customer needs.
  • Project Leadership in Professional Services: Lead professional service projects aimed at product customization and integrations, coordinating with customers to understand requirements and deliver solutions aligned with their business needs.
  • Critical Availability: Provide on-call support for critical escalations outside standard business hours as needed, prioritizing rapid resolution and customer satisfaction.
  • Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with development, QA, and product management teams to assist in developing and testing patches, updates, and scripts for issue resolution and software enhancements.
  • Team Mentorship and Skill Development: Mentor junior team members, fostering skill enhancement and knowledge-sharing across the support team.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Experience & Expertise:

  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in technical support or related fields in a software company, with a track record of successfully managing complex production environments.
  • Hands-on experience with Windows, Linux, and Mac OS environments, as well as multi-platform troubleshooting.
  • Networking knowledge, including TCP/IP, DNS, and SSL, with experience in packet capture and analysis.

Technical Proficiency:

  • Background in cloud infrastructure services (AWS, Azure) and familiarity with modern cloud-native architectures.
  • Familiarity with database administration (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL) and system automation tools to enhance support processes.
  • Competency in scripting or coding in one or more languages and familiarity with automation tools.
  • Experience with real-time data integrations using webhooks, API listeners, and other middleware solutions to enhance system interoperability.

Analytical & Troubleshooting Skills:

  • Strong diagnostic skills and proficiency in root-cause analysis, with the ability to implement proactive, preventative measures.
  • Ability to synthesize data insights to predict and address system bottlenecks and inefficiencies.

Leadership & Communication:

  • Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, for conveying complex technical information to diverse audiences.
  • Proven ability to lead support projects and initiatives, with a strong focus on customer satisfaction, teamwork, and collaboration.

Additional Desirable Skills:

  • Experience in technical support leadership roles, with the ability to delegate, prioritize, and coach effectively.
  • Expertise in technical documentation and knowledge management systems to empower both internal teams and end-users.
  • Ability to work flexible hours to support a 24/7 environment and provide guidance in high-pressure, critical situations.
INDSponsor

job.title: SAP EWM Consultant (x2) (32555)
job.description:
Our client, a global organization, is seeking two experienced SAP EWM Consultants for upcoming contract engagements. The successful candidates will support a hybrid work environment in the Greater Toronto Area and bring strong functional and technical expertise in Extended Warehouse Management.

Responsibilities:

  • Deliver end-to-end SAP EWM solutions across inbound, outbound, and internal warehouse processes

  • Configure and integrate SAP EWM with SAP TM or third-party TMS

  • Support integration with production (Advanced Production Integration), SD, and MM modules

  • Develop and maintain warehouse structures (e.g., Storage Types, Activity Areas)

  • Configure RF transactions and support associated development

  • Assist with S/4HANA plant configuration and go-live readiness

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 10 years of hands-on SAP EWM consulting experience

  • Proven track record on multiple full-cycle SAP EWM implementations

  • Deep functional knowledge across core EWM processes

  • Strong integration experience with SAP TM, SD, MM, and production modules

  • Experience with S/4HANA is a strong asset

  • Prior consulting experience with large, complex environments is preferred

Work Model: Hybrid – candidates must be able to attend onsite meetings in the GTA up to 3 times per week, as needed.

job.title: Lab Tech - Sampler (32552)
job.description:
Job Title: QA Sampler
Location: Grand Rapids, MI
Company: Clover Consulting (a Myticas Company)
Contract Length: 6-month initial contract with potential extension up to 3 years
Work Schedule: On-site | Monday–Friday, 7:00 AM – 3:30 PM

Job Summary:
Clover Consulting, on behalf of our direct client in Grand Rapids, MI, is seeking a QA Sampler for an on-site role. This position involves sampling raw materials and packaging components used in cosmetic, home care, and food industry products. The role includes basic quality checks and data logging, with opportunities for future growth into laboratory roles.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Sample raw materials and packaging components across multiple warehouse locations.

  • Ensure proper inspection and sampling of materials, including food-grade materials and known allergens.

  • Inspect packaging components for defects during sampling.

  • Accurately record sampling data in the QA data system.

  • Deliver samples to designated laboratories (Microbiology, Chemistry, and Packaging).

  • Maintain compliance with required safety and quality protocols.

Requirements:

  • Valid State of Michigan driver’s license (intra-facility travel required).

  • Must wear shoes with full leather uppers during sampling.

  • Basic computer proficiency required.

  • Background or degree in science is preferred but not mandatory.

To Apply:
Qualified candidates are encouraged to submit their resume for immediate consideration.

job.title: IT Director (PMO - Project Management Office) - THREE DAYS ONSITE (32554)
job.description:
Job Title: Director, IT (PMO)
Location: Ottawa – Hybrid (3 Days On-Site, Mandatory and Non-Negotiable)
Type: Full-Time, Permanent (8-Hour Workday)
Language Requirement: Bilingual Preferred (French/English)
Security Clearance: Must obtain clearance equivalent to Enhanced Reliability Status (Canada)
Eligibility: Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident

About the Role

The Director of IT (PMO) is a strategic leadership position responsible for aligning IT initiatives with enterprise objectives and ensuring the successful delivery of high-impact technology projects. The Director will provide expert guidance, foster cross-functional collaboration, and oversee a portfolio of projects that deliver long-term organizational value.

This role will lead the development and enforcement of a consistent IT project management framework, ensuring compliance with standardized methodologies and governance practices. The Director will also provide senior leadership with timely insights into project health, risk exposure, and emerging opportunities across the portfolio.

Key Responsibilities

Strategic Portfolio Oversight

  • Drive the evolution and adoption of the IT PMO framework to ensure alignment with organizational goals.

  • Manage the enterprise-wide IT project portfolio, prioritizing initiatives and optimizing resource allocation.

  • Advise executive stakeholders using data-driven insights to support strategic investment and resource planning.

Project Leadership and Governance

  • Lead and mentor project managers and support staff to promote high performance and accountability.

  • Establish and enforce governance standards across all projects.

  • Proactively identify and manage risks, implementing mitigation strategies to ensure successful delivery.

Executive Collaboration

  • Engage regularly with senior leadership to align on digital strategy, planning, and delivery progress.

  • Prepare and deliver executive-level reports and presentations that support informed decision-making.

  • Handle sensitive and confidential project data with integrity and discretion.

Risk Management

  • Identify risks across individual projects and the broader portfolio, escalating critical issues as required.

  • Develop and implement contingency plans to ensure project continuity.

Process Optimization and Continuous Improvement

  • Analyze project outcomes to identify areas for improvement and incorporate lessons learned.

  • Promote the use of modern tools and delivery methodologies, including Agile and hybrid approaches.

  • Continuously refine PMO structures and practices to enhance organizational effectiveness.

Reporting and Metrics

  • Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) for project and portfolio success.

  • Provide concise, data-driven reports and dashboards to executive stakeholders.

Project Execution

  • Lead the end-to-end delivery of complex, high-impact IT projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and with strong stakeholder engagement.

Qualifications and Experience

Education

  • Post-secondary degree or diploma in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

Experience

  • Minimum of 8 years of progressive experience in IT project management.

  • At least 2 years in a leadership role managing a PMO or IT project portfolio.

Certifications

  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is required.

Key Skills

  • Demonstrated experience leading enterprise-wide IT projects and managing PMO teams.

  • Proven ability to work with C-suite executives and handle confidential information.

  • In-depth knowledge of project management methodologies, including Waterfall, Agile, and hybrid models.

  • Proficiency in tools such as Microsoft Project, Jira, and Smartsheet.

  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, and organizational skills.

  • Ability to manage multiple projects and competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

job.title: EDW Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst (32542)
job.description:
EDW Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst

Duration: 12 months with possible multi-year extension/s

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) is are seeking a highly experienced EDW Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst for a large, direct client in Springfield, IL.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Gathering and analyzing technical information from various sources to be included in the documentation.
  • Planning, writing, and maintaining detailed technical, operational, and process documentation.
  • Leading, developing, and maintaining a library of technical and business documentation source code and reports.
  • Analyze Medicaid program including claims, eligibility, and provider data supporting data warehouse downstream reporting and analytics.
  • Developing and supporting technical training materials.
  • Modifying existing technical documentation for business needs.
  • Participating in and leading technical and business requirements sessions.
  • Meeting with the project team regularly to consolidate project status and reporting.
  • Engaging with the customer as needed to provide updates on technical documentation and project work.
  • Working with the development and QA team to assure each document has been thoroughly reviewed and support process improvements and operational efficiency.
  • Mentoring/Coaching other project team members on effective writing skills and strategies for consistency.
  • Performing additional duties that are typically associated with this position, as assigned.

Required Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of healthcare business analysis experience supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and user acceptance testing of various systems.
  • 5+ years of experience serving as a technical analyst in healthcare (payor).
  • 3+ years of experience working specifically with Medicaid programs, MMIS/MES or related systems.
  • 3+ years of experience in knowledge management creating, organizing, sharing, and optimizing knowledge within an enterprise organization using tools such as Microsoft 365, AI-enabled search, MS SharePoint/Teams, and JIRA.
  • Proven ability to lead communication (written and verbal) at the customer leadership level.
  • Knowledge of health insurance, HMO, and managed care principles including Medicaid and Medicare regulation.
  • Ability to interpret federal and state Medicaid policy and translate it into business and technical requirements.
  • Effective organizational, analytical, time management, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills, and habits; ability to complete assignments under tight deadlines with little/no direct supervision.
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, information systems, Public Health, or a related field

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Master’s Degree in related field is preferred.
  • 5+ years of experience as a technical analyst in payor healthcare.
  • 3+ years of experience writing SQL using large-scale database management tools.
  • 3+ years of experience working with State Medicaid and CHIP agencies including federal reporting (CMS 64/21, TMSIS, PERM). Enterprise Data Warehouse - Sr. Healthcare Technical Analyst
  • Knowledge of data integration, software enhancements/planning and agile methodologies
  • Experience with using Azure DevOps, SharePoint, MS Project, Visio

job.title: Senior System Engineer (32529)
job.description:
The Senior System Engineer will contribute to our clients program in conducting advance performance assessment studies for system configurations as needed to provide solution for complex customer needs. Using his / her expertise in satellite communications, orbital configuration and large communication networks, the candidate will define solutions with enough details to enable implementation across their system.

Main Responsibilities

  • Develop new solutions to commercial needs using their system, including among others solutions for low latency high capacity services, hosted satellite (space relay) services, mobile services, and other new configurations to support opportunities.
  • Support sales activities by evaluating complex use cases using internal and commercially available simulation tools.
  • Evaluate system performance boundaries by incorporating realistic user traffic profiles and terminal mix.
  • Help prepare and manage feature development roadmap in collaboration with commercial and engineering teams by evaluating value-add.
  • Develop technical documentation and reports.
  • Prepare and deliver high quality technical presentations supporting the delivery of solutions.

Education and Experience Required

  • B. Sc. in Electrical, Computer or System Engineering and a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in satellite communications or other large communication systems.
  • Experience in system simulations and service performance assessments.
  • Programming experience in Matlab and / or Python.
  • Knowledge of radio communication systems and/or satellite communication is desirable (experience with link budgets is an asset).

Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Creative problem-solver with thorough attention to detail.
  • Highly collaborative team-player who can quickly earn the confidence of co-workers and teammates.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Experience with STK for orbital analyses is an asset.
  • Fluent in English, written and oral.
  • Computers running Windows and Linux

job.title: Network & Telecom Project Leader (32492)
job.description:
Network & Telecom Project Lead
Location: Onsite – Winchester, VA
Employment Type: Direct Hire (W2 Only)
Eligibility: Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a W2 basis. We are unable to accept candidates requiring sponsorship or those from C2C vendors.

Company: Clover Consulting (a Myticas Company)
Client: Direct client – Onsite, direct hire opportunity. Local candidates in or near Winchester, VA, are highly preferred.

Position Summary

The Network & Telecom Project Lead is a key member of the Information Technology team, responsible for partnering with business and IT leaders to deliver robust network and telecommunications services that support critical business operations and applications across the enterprise.

This role requires deep expertise in managing and supporting network and telecom operations, including data centers, networking, telecommunications, cybersecurity, compliance, and related services. The position will also manage relationships with external vendors that provide network and telecom capabilities.

As a strategic contributor to the IT department, the Network & Telecom Project Lead plays a vital role in the development and execution of the enterprise-wide IT strategy. The role is accountable for ensuring that network and telecommunications strategies are aligned with the broader business objectives and deliver measurable value. The position emphasizes customer service excellence, with a focus on system availability, performance, reliability, security, and adherence to established service level metrics.

Preferred Experience

  • 5+ years of experience in Network Engineering/Architecture

  • 3+ years of IT support experience

  • 2+ years of Cisco support experience (preferred)

  • Strong hands-on experience configuring Cisco products and other communication equipment in a global enterprise environment

  • Proven experience with installation, configuration, and management of routers, switches, and wireless devices

  • Broad networking expertise including planning, design, testing, integration, and deployment of secure, high-speed, resilient voice, data, and video networks

  • Network certification (CCNP, CCIE) or equivalent experience preferred

  • Broad knowledge of system, network, and security best practices

  • Strong understanding of IT infrastructure components

  • Familiarity with common security vulnerabilities and mitigation techniques

  • Experience with infrastructure management tools

  • Hands-on experience with virtualization platforms such as VMware and Citrix

  • Practical experience with Microsoft servers and Active Directory

  • Experience with cloud-based services such as Office 365, SSO, AWS, or Azure

  • Proficiency in networking, cloud, server, storage, and client technologies (SAN, VSAN, IaaS, automation, backup, business continuity, disaster recovery, ITSM, VoIP, LAN, WAN, SD-WAN, clients, mobile, video, VDI, SBC)

Required Skills

  • Effective influencing and negotiation skills in cross-functional environments

  • Strong analytical, conceptual thinking, strategic planning, and execution capabilities

  • Solid business acumen, with a deep understanding of enterprise operations and industry trends

  • Ability to build consensus, make complex decisions, and drive initiatives forward

  • High standards of personal ethics, professionalism, and dedication

  • Up-to-date knowledge of current and emerging network and telecom technologies

  • Understanding of regulatory and compliance requirements related to network and telecom services

  • Expertise in IT infrastructure operations and best practices (e.g., ITIL)

  • Ability to manage and improve infrastructure processes and service delivery

Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field

Essential Functions

  • Provide technical leadership for all network and telecom projects and technologies, ensuring alignment with strategic goals

  • Participate in the development of IT architecture, technology roadmaps, and governance related to enterprise modernization efforts

  • Define and communicate strategic direction for core technologies, including networking, cloud, servers, storage, and client systems (SAN, VSAN, IaaS, automation, backup, disaster recovery, ITSM, VoIP, LAN, WAN, SD-WAN, mobile, video, VDI, SBC)

  • Monitor and improve customer satisfaction and service delivery performance

  • Lead the design, planning, implementation, and maintenance of network and telecom services supporting business operations

  • Establish service levels and ensure performance KPIs are consistently met

  • Oversee root cause analysis for network and telecom-related incidents, including problem tracking, post-mortems, and action follow-up

  • Develop and manage a comprehensive IT Service Management (ITSM) framework based on industry best practices

  • Provide insights on emerging technologies to enhance network and telecom services and align with business strategy

  • Support the development of sourcing strategies and manage strategic vendor relationships

  • Participate in IT planning and governance committees to drive technology standards and performance metrics

Scope & Expectations

Working Conditions:
Primarily works in an office environment; occasional work on or around the manufacturing or distribution floor may be required. The noise level is typically moderate.

Physical Requirements:
Regularly required to sit, talk, or hear. Frequently uses hands to handle or feel objects and reaches with arms. Occasionally stands and walks. Infrequent lifting of items up to 20 pounds may be required.

Equipment Used:
Standard office equipment, including computers, software, hardware, mouse, telephones, and other necessary technology. May work in computer room environments where servers and related systems are housed.

Reporting:
Reports to the Manager, Network & Telecom Services.

Travel Requirements:
Minimal to no travel required for this position.

job.title: Software Architect – System Model Application (32513)
job.description:
Job Description: Software Architect – System Model Application

Our Software Development team architects, develops, tests, and maintains a state-of-the-art engineering software tool that runs on high-performance computing (HPC) infrastructure. This application is designed to model resource allocation and end-to-end communication system performance for a next-generation satellite constellation.

As a Software Architect, the selected candidate will play a key leadership role in the software’s development, productization, and ongoing maintenance. This position provides critical day-to-day technical direction to team members, fostering a cohesive and productive development environment. The Software Architect will also collaborate with cross-functional engineering teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment with organizational goals.

Main Responsibilities

  • Lead the design, development, and deployment of the System Model suite, enhancing its readiness as a production-grade engine for operational business applications running in HPC environments—both cloud-based and on-premise.

  • Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and support to the development team, encouraging innovation and collaboration.

  • Develop and propose solutions to complex technical challenges, including recommendations on software architecture and technology stacks.

  • Collaborate with system engineers, product owners, and testing teams to gather requirements and deliver robust software solutions.

  • Produce clear technical documentation for internal stakeholders and external collaborators.

Education and Experience Required

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.

  • Extensive hands-on experience in software development.

  • Prior experience in a technical leadership or architecture role.

  • Proficiency in programming languages including C/C++, Golang, Java, Python, SQL, and Bash.

  • Experience with tools and technologies such as Kubernetes (including Helm charts), Terraform, Packer, Ansible, containerization, and secret management (e.g., Azure Key Vault, HashiCorp Vault).

  • Familiarity with Azure Cloud services, including fundamentals, IAM, and networking.

  • Experience with Matlab and related best practices is an asset.

  • Comfortable working within Agile development environments.

  • Experience with cluster job managers.

  • Background in satellite or communication systems is beneficial but not required.

  • 10+ years of professional experience in software development or system architecture.

Additional Skills and Abilities

  • Strong problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.

  • Collaborative team player who fosters a positive, innovative team environment.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

  • Proven ability to effectively engage with stakeholders, engineering teams, and partners.

  • Solid understanding of the business context and constraints of software system design and deployment.

  • Ability to manage competing priorities and project demands.

  • Passion for learning and working with complex systems and technologies.

  • Fluency in English (written and spoken); French is an asset.

job.title: Senior DevOps/Cloud Engineer (32515)
job.description:
Must Haves:

  • You have proven expertise in designing, deploying, and managing complex cloud solutions leveraging a wide array of Azure services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS).
  • You have deep practical experience with Docker for containerization and expert-level proficiency in managing and optimizing Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters across development, UAT and production environments.
  • You are a champion of industry cloud and security standards, consistently applying best practices that can be adopted and scaled across the organization
  • You are expert in designing, implementing and maintaining comprehensive CI/CD pipelines that automate builds, deployments, and cloud infrastructure, ensuring seamless and efficient delivery of software solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Design, build and support cloud environments to create digital products
  • Monitor and assess the performance of applications in a cloud environment to ensure solutions are available
  • Create, test and implement safeguards to maintain data integrity and protect against unauthorized access

GENERAL SKILLS:

  • Experience in one of the leading cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud, etc
  • Experience in maintaining complex Linux cloud environments, like CentOS, Ubuntu, or CoreOS, to support modern web technologies: LAMP, MEAN, Drupal and Elasticsearch
  • Experience setting up development environments and mechanism using tools such as JIRA, Confluence, Maven and Jenkins or similar tools
  • Experience in scripting languages like Python, Bash, PHP, Java, JavaScript, Node, etc.
  • Experience in build tools like Git, Ansible, Chef, Puppet etc. for continuous integration
  • Knowledge of container-based virtualization technology like Docker
  • Integration experience in building and using APIs
  • Experience applying industry web, architectural and security standards and best practices
  • Experience in mobile device management for various versions of cellular and tablets

EXPERIENCE AND SKILL SET REQUIREMENTS

Technical Knowledge and Cloud Architecture - 55%

  • You have proven expertise in designing, deploying, and managing complex cloud solutions leveraging a wide array of Azure services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS).
  • You have deep practical experience with Docker for containerization and expert-level proficiency in managing and optimizing Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters across development, UAT and production environments.
  • You have proven experience designing, implementing, and supporting microservices.
  • You have strong track record of integrating with and building robust APIs to deliver API-enabled solutions, improving overall functionality, scalability, security and interoperability.
  • You have in-depth technical knowledge of complex system architectures, encompassing technical, data, application, and network layers.
  • You are fluent in multiple scripting and programming languages including Python, Bash, C#, and JavaScript, Node.js
  • You are proficient in using Git for source code management and automation tools like Ansible, Puppet, Chef, or Terraform for continuous integration
  • Hands-on experience with both relational and non-relational databases.

DevOps Standards and Best Practices - 25 %

  • You are a champion of industry cloud and security standards, consistently applying best practices that can be adopted and scaled across the organization
  • You are expert in designing, implementing and maintaining comprehensive CI/CD pipelines that automate builds, deployments, and cloud infrastructure, ensuring seamless and efficient delivery of software solutions.
  • Skilled at balancing the resolution of technical debt with the delivery of innovative enhancements through continuous iteration, ensuring system stability and ongoing improvements.
  • You are proactively researching industry best practices to support DevOps standards and applying them to improve existing workflows and systems

Leadership, Communication and Project Delivery - 20%

  • You are a strong communicator who collaborates closely with multi-disciplinary teams, translating complex technical concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholder
  • You have strong leadership skills, providing guidance and mentorship to team members
  • You are skilled in identifying IT risks and developing effective contingency plans
  • You are able to influence others through persuasive communication rather than authority
  • You are comfortable leading technical discussions, effectively presenting ideas to product team as well as senior managers
  • You are expert in analyzing designs to identify coding and/or integration issues, and providing practical resolutions and support.
  • You are experienced in providing support for multiple products across multiple cloud environments with a strong focus on security, reliability, scalability and quality.

job.title: MES Analyst/SAP MII Developer (32486)
job.description:
Myticas Consulting has a direct client in need of a MES Analyst/SAP MII Developer in Manchester, Michigan. This is a HYBRID direct hire role. Prefer candidates located in Michigan.

Provide business support to manufacturing operations utilizing the SAP MII platform custom-developed shop floor application. Maintain and develop SAP MII application for customized functionality as required for shop floor data collection and transactional execution. Manage interfaces to external systems (including OPC Servers, PLCs, and other connectors for collecting data) transforming as needed and loading into SAP ECC. Specific responsibilities and duties include:

  • Support global SAP MII implementation and projects (Netweaver, MII, PCo, and NWDI).
  • Support and/or develop MII custom application.
  • Develop interfaces to manufacturing equipment as needed for automated data collection.
  • Manage all code in a formal source control system (NWDI) including change management procedures.
  • Develop barcode labels needed for internal and external customers.
  • Develop and manage interfaces to SAP ECC.
  • Develop systems documentation and training materials.
  • Train end users across various levels of Amcor’s organization.
  • Implement on-going release management processes to support the shop floor functions.
  • Provide manufacturing business post go-live support.
  • Domestic travel to Amcor manufacturing plants may require up to 50% of the time during projects; International travel up to 2 trips per year. This position is located at Amcor’s Manchester, MI site, with option to telecommute from anywhere in the United States; Required attendance of special events and meetings at Manchester, MI site, as assigned by supervisor.

Minimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree or the foreign equivalent in Electrical and Computer Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering Systems Technology, Computer Science or a closely related engineering or computer science field and 10 years of progressively responsible post-Bachelor’s experience as MES Analyst/SAP MII Developer, Programmer Analyst, Software Engineer, or in a closely related occupation involving SAP. Experience to include:

  • 10 years performing SAP MII analysis, development, and project implementation.
  • 10 years designing and implementing complex solutions with SAP MII.
  • 10 years creating query templates, display templates, business logic transactions, reports, and web page user interfaces.
  • 5 years working for a manufacturing company.
  • 5 years working with Oracle and DB2 databases.
  • 5 years performing web development, including Java Scripting.
  • 2 years establishing, configuring, and maintaining SAP ECC interfaces to SAP MII MES systems.

All education, experience, and training may be gained concurrently. Applicants must be U.S. workers (includes U.S. citizens, permanent residents, foreign nationals granted temporary residence under one of the 1986 legalization programs, refugees, and asylees).

job.title: ASIC Development Engineer (32477)
job.description:
Position: Senior ASIC Design Engineer – Optical Communication Systems

Our client’s team is expanding and seeking highly motivated, experienced professional engineers to help develop next-generation systems in a rapidly growing and competitive industry. This is an excellent opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge technologies in optical communication. Candidates must hold a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or possess equivalent professional experience.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop state-of-the-art electronic devices and intellectual property (IP) for optical communication systems.
  • Apply proven expertise in deep sub-micron silicon technologies.
  • Collaborate effectively within a multi-site, international development team.
  • Design ASIC devices for the processing of optical signals.

Required Qualifications and Skills:

  • Master’s degree or PhD in Electronic Engineering, Telecommunication Engineering, or a related discipline.
  • A minimum of 8 years of demonstrated experience in deep sub-micron ASIC design.
  • Proficiency in VHDL and/or Verilog for development and ASIC verification.
  • Preferred experience in digital signal processing (DSP) and forward error correction (FEC) design.
  • Experience with high-speed analog design is a plus.
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Excellent teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate across international teams and time zones.
  • Effective communication skills, including fluency in English.

job.title: RAN Network - Customer Support (32467)
job.description:
<span style="font-size: 11.0pt;"><span style="font-family: Calibri , sans-serif;">Customer Support Engineer</span></span>

Customer Support Engineer – RAN (Radio Access Network)
Location: Onsite in Chicago, IL
Note: No Corp-to-Corp engagements.
Security Clearance: Must be able to obtain and maintain security clearance.

Job Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Customer Support Engineer specializing in RAN to work as an onsite Resident Engineer with our customer in Chicago. The ideal candidate will have recent, hands-on experience supporting RAN technologies and meeting the responsibilities outlined below.

  • Perform first-level troubleshooting and respond to anomalies in RAN network elements.
  • Escalate unresolved issues by creating detailed support tickets.

job.title: Software Developer - (Java) / Technical Consultant, Senior (Perm-FTE) (32247)
job.description:
RESPONSIBILITES

  • Develop software solutions by studying information needs, conferring with users, studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes, investigating problem areas, and following the software development lifecycle.
  • Implement well-designed, testable, and efficient codes according to project requirements and adhere to coding standards, guidelines, quality procedures, and schedules.
  • Lead software projects from scoping requirements through actual launch and implementation.
  • Collaborate with team members on analysis, design reviews, and testing.
  • Document and demonstrate solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments, and clear code.
  • Perform thorough unit testing and support in resolving defects while ensuring proper documentation of all activities.
  • Complete peer-to-peer code reviews and improve operations by conducting systems analysis and recommending changes in policies and procedures.
  • Provide inputs and assist in the preparation of high-level designs.
  • Protect operations by keeping information confidential.

What do I need to succeed?

MUST HAVE:

  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or software or systems engineering.
  • 6+ years of working experience as a Software Engineer with a consistent track record of delivery, preferably in an agile environment.
  • Experience using Eclipse, Maven, and source control (SVN, Git).
  • Well-versed in JAVA, J2EE, Spring Boot, design patterns, Web Services, REST-based APIs, Apache Kafka, schema registry, Apache Nifi.
  • Must have client-facing experience.
  • Clear and concise verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate with all levels of an organization, both internally and externally.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to foster team collaboration.
  • Be proactive with a strong desire to learn.
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills with the ability to create innovative solutions.
  • Ability to work across multiple project areas and manage competing responsibilities simultaneously.
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with object oriented and functional design patterns.
  • Knowledge of and experience with PostgreSQL database
  • Create coding and design guidelines to be used throughout our applications;

  • Knowledge of and familiarity with Java build systems, i.e. Maven

NICE TO HAVE:

  • Application development experience in an Agile environment using TDD and BDD.
